flixel.util.FlxAngle

type
class
A set of functions related to angle calculations.

Static Variables

TO_DEG : Float

Convert radians to degrees by multiplying it with this value.

TO_RAD : Float

Convert degrees to radians by multiplying it with this value.

cosTable : Array<Float>

Use this to access the cos-table generated via sinCosGenerator().

sinTable : Array<Float>

Use this to access the sin-table generated via sinCosGenerator().

Static Methods

inline angleBetween(SpriteA : flixel.FlxSprite, SpriteB : flixel.FlxSprite, ?AsDegrees : Bool) : Float

parameters
SpriteA The FlxSprite to test from
SpriteB The FlxSprite to test to
AsDegrees If you need the value in degrees instead of radians, set to true
returns
The angle (in radians unless asDegrees is true)
Find the angle (in radians) between the two FlxSprite, taking their x/y and origin into account. The angle is calculated in clockwise positive direction (down = 90 degrees positive, right = 0 degrees positive, up = 90 degrees negative)

angleBetweenMouse(Object : flixel.FlxObject, ?AsDegrees : Bool) : Float

parameters
Object The FlxObject to test from
AsDegrees If you need the value in degrees instead of radians, set to true
returns
The angle (in radians unless AsDegrees is true)
Find the angle (in radians) between an FlxSprite and the mouse, taking their x/y and origin into account. The angle is calculated in clockwise positive direction (down = 90 degrees positive, right = 0 degrees positive, up = 90 degrees negative)

angleBetweenPoint(Sprite : flixel.FlxSprite, Target : FlxPoint, ?AsDegrees : Bool) : Float

parameters
Sprite The FlxSprite to test from
Target The FlxPoint to angle the FlxSprite towards
AsDegrees If you need the value in degrees instead of radians, set to true
returns
The angle (in radians unless AsDegrees is true)
Find the angle (in radians) between an FlxSprite and an FlxPoint. The source sprite takes its x/y and origin into account. The angle is calculated in clockwise positive direction (down = 90 degrees positive, right = 0 degrees positive, up = 90 degrees negative)

inline angleBetweenTouch(Object : flixel.FlxObject, Touch : flixel.system.input.touch.FlxTouch, ?AsDegrees : Bool) : Float

parameters
Object The FlxObject to test from
Touch The FlxTouch to test to
AsDegrees If you need the value in degrees instead of radians, set to true
returns
The angle (in radians unless AsDegrees is true)
Find the angle (in radians) between an FlxSprite and a FlxTouch, taking their x/y and origin into account. The angle is calculated in clockwise positive direction (down = 90 degrees positive, right = 0 degrees positive, up = 90 degrees negative)

angleLimit(angle : Int, min : Int, max : Int) : Int

parameters
angle The angle value to check. Must be between -180 and +180
min The minimum angle that is allowed (must be -180 or greater)
max The maximum angle that is allowed (must be 180 or less)
returns
The new angle value, returns the same as the input angle if it was within bounds
Keeps an angle value between the given min and max values

inline asDegrees(radians : Float) : Float

parameters
radians The value in radians
returns
Degrees
Converts a Radian value into a Degree Converts the radians value into degrees and returns

inline asRadians(degrees : Float) : Float

parameters
degrees The value in degrees
returns
Radians
Converts a Degrees value into a Radian Converts the degrees value into radians and returns

inline getAngle(Point1 : FlxPoint, Point2 : FlxPoint) : Float

parameters
Point1 The X coordinate of the point.
Point2 The Y coordinate of the point.
returns
The angle in degrees, between -180 and 180.
Calculates the angle between two points. 0 degrees points straight up.

inline rotatePoint(X : Float, Y : Float, PivotX : Float, PivotY : Float, Angle : Float, ?point : FlxPoint) : FlxPoint

parameters
X The X coordinate of the point you want to rotate.
Y The Y coordinate of the point you want to rotate.
PivotX The X coordinate of the point you want to rotate around.
PivotY The Y coordinate of the point you want to rotate around.
Angle Rotate the point by this many degrees.
Point Optional FlxPoint to store the results in.
returns
A FlxPoint containing the coordinates of the rotated point.
Rotates a point in 2D space around another point by the given angle.

sinCosGenerator(length : Int, ?sinAmplitude : Float, ?cosAmplitude : Float, ?frequency : Float) : Void

parameters
length The length of the wave
sinAmplitude The amplitude to apply to the sine table (default 1.0) if you need values between say -+ 125 then give 125 as the value
cosAmplitude The amplitude to apply to the cosine table (default 1.0) if you need values between say -+ 125 then give 125 as the value
frequency The frequency of the sine and cosine table data
returns
Returns the sine table
see
getSinTable
getCosTable
Generate a sine and cosine table simultaneously and extremely quickly. Based on research by Franky of scene.at The parameters allow you to specify the length, amplitude and frequency of the wave. Once you have called this function you should get the results via sinTable and cosTable. This generator is fast enough to be used in real-time.

wrapAngle(angle : Float) : Int

parameters
angle The angle value to check
returns
The new angle value, returns the same as the input angle if it was within bounds
Keeps an angle value between -180 and +180 Should be called whenever the angle is updated on a FlxSprite to stop it from going insane.
